Pre-Game Insights: Craig Bellamy is focusing on creating a new identity for Wales ahead of their UEFA Nations League campaign.
Bellamy has redrawn the team's vision and identity, with changes in training times and formats.
Andrew Crofts, James Rowberry, Piet Cremers, Ryland Morgans, and Martyn Margetson have joined Bellamy's backroom staff.
Bellamy is determined to prove concerns over his temperament unfounded.
Bellamy is passionate and intense, but has found a balance in his new role.
Bellamy is focused on creating an identity and bonding with the Welsh people and culture.
Bellamy is eager to show that Wales has an identity ingrained within his ethos.
Bellamy wants Aaron Ramsey to show his talent as a playmaker.
Bellamy expects a high-pressing side that is busy off the ball as much as on it.
Bellamy's ultimate aim is for Wales to qualify for the World Cup in 2026.
Bellamy is dealing with withdrawals and injuries, including Dan James, Rabbi Matondo, and Liam Cullen.
Charlie Crew has been added to the squad due to fitness concerns over other players.
